refnamediv.refpurpose: proxy object for an account in the Telepathy account manager

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "connect-automatically" gboolean : Read "connection" TpConnection* : Read "connection-manager" gchar* : Read "connection-status" guint : Read "connection-status-reason" guint : Read "current-presence-type" guint : Read "current-status" gchar* : Read "current-status-message" gchar* : Read "display-name" gchar* : Read "enabled" gboolean : Read "has-been-online" gboolean : Read "icon-name" gchar* : Read "nickname" gchar* : Read "protocol" gchar* : Read "requested-presence-type" guint : Read "requested-status" gchar* : Read "requested-status-message" gchar* : Read "valid" gboolean : Read

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The Telepathy Account Manager stores the user's configured real-time communication accounts. The TpAccount object represents a stored account.

refsect2.title: TpAccount
refsect2.para: The current status message message of the account.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is NULL.
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: TpAccountClass
refsect2.para: The class of a TpAccount.

refsect2.title: tp_account_new ()
refsect2.para: Convenience function to create a new account proxy. The returned TpAccount is not guaranteed to be ready at the point of return.

listitem.simpara: The non-NULL object path of this account
Used to raise an error if object_path is not valid
a new reference to an account proxy, or NULL if object_path is not valid

refsect2.title: tp_account_init_known_interfaces ()
refsect2.para: Ensure that the known interfaces for TpAccount have been set up. This is done automatically when necessary, but for correct overriding of library interfaces by local extensions, you should call this function before calling tp_proxy_or_subclass_hook_on_interface_add() with first argument TP_TYPE_ACCOUNT.
Since 0.7.32

refsect2.title: tp_account_parse_object_path ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_account_parse_object_path (const gchar *object_path, gchar **cm, gchar **protocol, gchar **account_id, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Validates and parses a Telepathy Account's object path, extracting the connection manager's name, the protocol, and the account's unique identifier from the path. This includes replacing underscores with hyphens in the protocol name, as defined in the Account specification.
Any of the out parameters may be NULL if not needed.

listitem.simpara: location at which to store the account's connection manager's name
location at which to store the account's protocol
location at which to store the account's unique identifier
location at which to return an error
TRUE if object_path was successfully parsed; FALSE and sets error otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_connection ()
refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_ensure_connection ()
refsect2.para: Set the connection of the account by specifying the connection object path. This function does not return a new ref and it is not guaranteed that the returned TpConnection object is ready.
The use-case for this function is in a HandleChannels callback and you already know the object path for the connection, so you can let account create its TpConnection and return it for use.

listitem.simpara: the path to connection object for TpAccount
the connection of the account, or NULL if either the object path path is invalid or it is the null-value "/"

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_display_name ()
refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_connection_manager ()
refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_protocol ()
refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_icon_name ()
refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_set_enabled_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_account_set_enabled_async (TpAccount *account, gboolean enabled, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous set of the Enabled property of account. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_set_enabled_finish() to get the result of the operation.

listitem.simpara: the new enabled value of account
a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_set_enabled_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async set of the Enabled property.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the set was successful, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_reconnect_async ()
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous reconnect of account. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_reconnect_finish() to get the result of the operation.

listitem.simpara: a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_reconnect_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async reconnect of account.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the reconnect call was successful, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_is_enabled ()
refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_is_valid ()
refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_update_parameters_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_account_update_parameters_async (TpAccount *account, GHashTable *parameters, const gchar **unset_parameters, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous update of parameters of account. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_update_parameters_finish() to get the result of the operation.

listitem.simpara: new parameters to set on account
list of parameters to unset on account
a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_update_parameters_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async update of the parameters on account.

listitem.simpara: a GStrv to fill with properties that need a reconnect to take effect
TRUE if the request succeeded, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_remove_async ()
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous removal of account. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_remove_finish() to get the result of the operation.

listitem.simpara: a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_remove_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async removal of account.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the operation was successful, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_set_display_name_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_account_set_display_name_async (TpAccount *account, const gchar *display_name, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous set of the DisplayName property of account. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_set_display_name_finish() to get the result of the operation.

listitem.simpara: a new display name, or NULL to unset the display name
a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_set_display_name_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async set of the DisplayName property.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the call was successful, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_set_icon_name_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_account_set_icon_name_async (TpAccount *account, const gchar *icon_name, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous set of the Icon property of account. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_set_icon_name_finish() to get the result of the operation.

listitem.simpara: a new icon name, or NULL to unset the icon name
a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_set_icon_name_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async set of the Icon parameter.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the operation was successful, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_request_presence_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_account_request_presence_async (TpAccount *account, TpConnectionPresenceType type, const gchar *status, const gchar *message, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous change of presence on account. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_request_presence_finish() to get the result of the operation.

listitem.simpara: a status message to set, or NULL
a message for the change, or NULL
a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_request_presence_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async presence change request on account.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the operation was successful, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_connect_automatically ()
refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_set_connect_automatically_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_account_set_connect_automatically_async (TpAccount *account, gboolean connect_automatically, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous set of the ConnectAutomatically property of account. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_set_display_name_finish() to get the result of the operation.

listitem.simpara: a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_set_connect_automatically_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async set of the ConnectAutomatically property.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the call was successful, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_has_been_online ()
refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_connection_status ()
refsect2.para: Gets the connection status and reason from account. The two values are the same as the "connection-status" and "connection-status-reason" properties.

listitem.simpara: a TpConnectionStatusReason to fill, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_current_presence ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current presence, status and status message of account. These values are the same as the "current-presence-type", "current-status" and "current-status-message" properties.

listitem.simpara: return location for the current status
return location for the current status message

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_requested_presence ()
refsect2.para: Gets the requested presence, status and status message of account. These values are the same as the "requested-presence-type", "requested-status" and "requested-status-message" properties.

listitem.simpara: return location for the requested status
return location for the requested status message

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_parameters ()

listitem.simpara: the hash table of parameters on account

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_nickname ()
refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_set_nickname_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_account_set_nickname_async (TpAccount *account, const gchar *nickname, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous change of the Nickname parameter on account. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_set_nickname_finish() to get the result of the operation.

listitem.simpara: a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_set_nickname_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async nickname change request on account.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the operation was successful, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_avatar_async ()
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous get of account's avatar. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_get_avatar_finish() to get the result of the operation.

listitem.simpara: a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_get_avatar_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async get operation of account's avatar.

listitem.simpara: a GArray of the account's avatar, or NULL on failure

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: TP_ACCOUNT_FEATURE_CORE
refsect2.para: Expands to a call to a function that returns a quark for the "core" feature on a TpAccount.
When this feature is prepared, the basic properties of the Account have been retrieved and are available for use, and change-notification has been set up.
One can ask for a feature to be prepared using the tp_account_prepare_async() function, and waiting for it to callback.
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_is_prepared ()

listitem.simpara: TRUE if feature is ready on account, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_prepare_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_account_prepare_async (TpAccount *account, const GQuark *features, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Requests an asynchronous preparation of account with the features specified by features. When the operation is finished, callback will be called. You can then call tp_account_prepare_finish() to get the result of the operation.
If features is NULL, then callback will be called when the implied TP_ACCOUNT_FEATURE_CORE feature is ready.

If NULL is given to callback, then no callback will be called when the operation is finished. Instead, it will simply set features on manager. Note that if callback is NULL, then user_data must also be NULL.

listitem.simpara: a 0-terminated list of features, or NULL
a callback to call when the request is satisfied

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_account_prepare_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes an async preparation of the account account.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the preparation was successful, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_callback_for_reconnect ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_account_callback_for_reconnect) (TpAccount *proxy, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a Reconnect method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
NULL on success, or an error on failure

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_call_reconnect ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_account_call_reconnect (TpAccount *proxy, gint timeout_ms, tp_cli_account_callback_for_reconnect callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a Reconnect method call.

Re-connect this account. If the account is currently disconnected and the requested presence is offline, or if the account is not Enabled or not Valid, this does nothing.

If the account is disconnected and the requested presence is not offline, this forces an attempt to connect with the requested presence immediately.

If the account is connecting or connected, this is equivalent to remembering the current value of RequestedPresence, setting its value to (OFFLINE, "offline", ""), waiting for the change to take effect, then setting its value to the value that was previously remembered.

Clients desiring "instant apply" semantics for CM parameters MAY call this method to achieve that.

In particular, if the account's Connection is in the Connecting state, calling this method causes the attempt to connect to be aborted and re-tried.

This is necessary to ensure that the new parameters are picked up.

listitem.simpara: the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_callback_for_remove ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_account_callback_for_remove) (TpAccount *proxy, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a Remove method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
NULL on success, or an error on failure

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_call_remove ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_account_call_remove (TpAccount *proxy, gint timeout_ms, tp_cli_account_callback_for_remove callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a Remove method call.
Delete the account.

listitem.simpara: the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_callback_for_update_parameters ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_account_callback_for_update_parameters) (TpAccount *proxy, const gchar **out_Reconnect_Required, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a UpdateParameters method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made

Used to return an 'out' argument if error is NULL: A list of the names of parameters with changes that will not take effect until the account is reconnected (this may be empty, e.g. if all the parameters are D-Bus properties or parameters for which the account manager has specific support). User interfaces that require "instant apply" semantics MAY call <tp:member-ref>Reconnect</tp:member-ref> in response to receiving a non-empty list.
NULL on success, or an error on failure

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_call_update_parameters ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_account_call_update_parameters (TpAccount *proxy, gint timeout_ms, GHashTable *in_Set, const gchar **in_Unset, tp_cli_account_callback_for_update_parameters callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a UpdateParameters method call.

Change the value of the Parameters property.

If any of the changed parameters' Conn_Mgr_Param_Flags include DBus_Property, the change will be applied to the corresponding D-Bus Property on the active Connection, if there is one. Changes to other parameters will not take effect until the next time the account is disconnected and reconnected.

In general, reconnecting is a destructive operation that shouldn't happen as a side-effect. In particular, migration tools that twiddle the settings of all accounts shouldn't cause an automatic disconnect and reconnect.

listitem.simpara: the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: A mapping from parameter names to their values. These parameters should be stored for future use.

Used to pass an 'in' argument: A list of the names of parameters to be removed from the set of stored values, allowing the default values to be used. If the given parameters were not, in fact, stored, or even if they do not exist at all, the account manager MUST accept this without error.
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_signal_callback_account_property_changed ()
refsect2.para: Represents the signature of a callback for the signal AccountPropertyChanged.

listitem.simpara: The proxy on which tp_cli_account_connect_to_account_property_changed() was called
A map from property names in this namespace (e.g. <tp:member-ref>Nickname</tp:member-ref>) to values. Properties whose values have not changed SHOULD be omitted, but this need not be done.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_connect_to_account_property_changed ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxySignalConnection * tp_cli_account_connect_to_account_property_changed (TpAccount *proxy, tp_cli_account_signal_callback_account_property_changed callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Connect a handler to the signal AccountPropertyChanged.

The values of one or more properties on this interface (that do not specify that this signal does not apply to them) may have changed. This does not cover properties of other interfaces, which must provide their own change notification if appropriate.

listitem.simpara: Callback to be called when the signal is received
Destructor for the user-supplied data, which will be called when this signal is disconnected, or before this function returns NULL
If not NULL, used to raise an error if NULL is returned
a TpProxySignalConnection containing all of the above, which can be used to disconnect the signal; or NULL if the proxy does not have the desired interface or has become invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_signal_callback_removed ()
refsect2.para: Represents the signature of a callback for the signal Removed.

listitem.simpara: The proxy on which tp_cli_account_connect_to_removed() was called

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_connect_to_removed ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxySignalConnection * tp_cli_account_connect_to_removed (TpAccount *proxy, tp_cli_account_signal_callback_removed callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Connect a handler to the signal Removed.

This account has been removed. <tp:rationale> This is redundant with <tp:dbus-ref namespace="org.freedesktop.Telepathy.AccountManager">AccountRemoved</tp:dbus-ref>, but it's still worth having, to avoid having to bind to AccountManager.AccountRemoved to tell you whether your Account is valid ideally, an account-editing UI should only care about a single Account. </tp:rationale>

listitem.simpara: Callback to be called when the signal is received
Destructor for the user-supplied data, which will be called when this signal is disconnected, or before this function returns NULL
If not NULL, used to raise an error if NULL is returned
a TpProxySignalConnection containing all of the above, which can be used to disconnect the signal; or NULL if the proxy does not have the desired interface or has become invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_interface_avatar_signal_callback_avatar_changed ()
refsect2.para: Represents the signature of a callback for the signal AvatarChanged.

listitem.simpara: The proxy on which tp_cli_account_interface_avatar_connect_to_avatar_changed() was called

refsect2.title: tp_cli_account_interface_avatar_connect_to_avatar_changed ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxySignalConnection * tp_cli_account_interface_avatar_connect_to_avatar_changed (TpAccount *proxy, tp_cli_account_interface_avatar_signal_callback_avatar_changed callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Connect a handler to the signal AvatarChanged.

Emitted when the Avatar property changes. <tp:rationale>The avatar itself is deliberately not included in this signal, to reduce bus traffic in the (likely common) case where no running application cares about the user's own avatar.</tp:rationale>

listitem.simpara: Callback to be called when the signal is received
Destructor for the user-supplied data, which will be called when this signal is disconnected, or before this function returns NULL
If not NULL, used to raise an error if NULL is returned
a TpProxySignalConnection containing all of the above, which can be used to disconnect the signal; or NULL if the proxy does not have the desired interface or has become invalid.

refsect2.title: The "connect-automatically" property
refsect2.para: Whether the account should connect automatically or not. To change this property, use tp_account_set_connect_automatically_async().
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is FALSE.
Default value: FALSE
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "connection" property
refsect2.para: The connection of the account, or NULL if account is offline. It is not guaranteed that the returned TpConnection object is ready.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is NULL.
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "connection-manager" property
refsect2.para: The account's connection manager name.
Default value: NULL
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "connection-status" property
refsect2.para: The account's connection status type.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is TP_CONNECTION_STATUS_DISCONNECTED.
Allowed values: <= 3
Default value: 2
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "connection-status-reason" property
refsect2.para: The account's connection status reason.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is TP_CONNECTION_STATUS_REASON_NONE_SPECIFIED.
Allowed values: <= 14
Default value: 0
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "current-presence-type" property
refsect2.para: The account connection's current presence type.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is TP_CONNECTION_PRESENCE_TYPE_UNSET.
Allowed values: <= 9
Default value: 0
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "current-status" property
refsect2.para: The current Status string of the account.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is NULL.
Default value: NULL
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "current-status-message" property
refsect2.para: The Status message string of the account.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "display-name" property
refsect2.para: The account's display name, from the DisplayName property.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is NULL.
Default value: NULL
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "enabled" property
refsect2.para: Whether this account is enabled or not.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is FALSE.
Default value: FALSE
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "has-been-online" property
refsect2.para: Whether this account has been online or not.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is FALSE.
Default value: FALSE
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "icon-name" property
refsect2.para: The account's icon name. To change this propery, use tp_account_set_icon_name_async().
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is NULL.
Default value: NULL
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "nickname" property
refsect2.para: The nickname that should be set for the user on this account.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is NULL.
Default value: NULL
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "protocol" property
refsect2.para: The account's protocol name.
Default value: NULL
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "requested-presence-type" property
refsect2.para: The account's requested presence type.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
Allowed values: <= 9
Default value: 0
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "requested-status" property
refsect2.para: The requested Status string of the account.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
Default value: NULL
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "requested-status-message" property
refsect2.para: The requested status message message of the account.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
Default value: NULL
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "valid" property
refsect2.para: Whether this account is valid.
One can receive change notifications on this property by connecting to the "notify" signal and using this property as the signal detail.
This is not guaranteed to have been retrieved until tp_account_prepare_async() has finished; until then, the value is FALSE.
Default value: FALSE
Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "presence-changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (TpAccount *account, guint presence, gchar *status, gchar *status_message, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when the presence of the account changes.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0

refsect2.title: The "status-changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (TpAccount *account, guint old_status, guint new_status, guint reason, gchar *dbus_error_name, GHashTable *details, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when the connection status on the account changes.

listitem.simpara: the reason for the status change
currently unused, but for exposing the dbus error name on a connection error in the future
currently unused, but for exposing the error details on a connection error in the future
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 0.9.0
